place_of_publication.publication_title: in J. Franklin et al., Narr. Journey Polar Sea,

bio:treatment.discussion: Varieties of Senecio eremophilus are distinguished by head size and distribution. Varieties eremophilus and macdougalii are notably different; var. kingii is intermediate in both morphology and distribution.

key_statement.description: Calyculi: bractlets prominent (lengths of at least some to about 3 / 4 phyllaries); involucres 7–10 mm diam.; phyllaries 6–8 mm, tips green or weakly, if at all, black
Calyculi: bractlets conspicuous or inconspicuous (lengths rarely to 1 / 2 phyllaries); involucres 5–8 mm diam.; phyllaries 3–6 mm, tips usually black.
Calyculi: bractlets conspicuous (lengths to 1 / 2 phyllaries); involucres (5–)6–8 diam.; phyllaries ± 13, (4–)5–6 mm
Calyculi: bractlets inconspicuous; involucres 4–5(–6) mm diam.; phyllaries ± 8 or ± 13, 3–5 mm
